summary: Sari Mordana was a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears in the HSCA staff payroll records. The Assassination Records Review Board postponed the release of her Social Security number from these records in 1995 due to privacy concerns. Documents related to her employment include payroll authorization forms, leave records, and correspondence.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Sari Mordana's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the specific nature of her role within the HSCA is not detailed in the provided documents, her presence in the payroll records indicates her involvement in the committee's operations. The postponement of the release of her Social Security number highlights the privacy considerations surrounding the release of HSCA staff information.
